answers.answer: I feel a little odd having my son 12, daughter 11 and now expecting a baby in September. Then will turn 35 in October.  Luckily my daughter can't wait to help. Focus on the positive : )

Some call me insane for having a baby at 37.  Others call me genius for waiting until my eldest was 13 and I have a built in babysitter. ;-)I think a LOT of the "feeling old" comes from the advanced maternam age automatically slapped onto our prenatal records because we are 35+.  Our prenatal appointments are different, the tests they want to run are more numerous, the risks we run are more plentiful due to age (diabetes, thyroid, hypertension, etc).  We can be amazingly healthy and low risk as individuals, but we are lumped into a generally higher risk age group.  It tends to make us all anxious.
My first and will be 43 when I have my princesse. I felt I was way past having a child.  As time has gone by I just feel blessed and been told I have more wisdom to be a better mom
I do feel old having a baby at 39

I feel old sometimes. I think it's just the added strain on my body. I found my first grey hair last month also. I do agree that the advanced maternal age label bothers me though. These doctors act like I'm 80. If they'd give me a walker already, I'd probably make it through the stores faster!  And besides all these extra tests and such this has been my healthiest pregnancy. No gestational diabetes, bladder/kidney/ UT infections, abnormal test results etc.

I think it is added strain but it's all in what you make of it.  Women now days are having babies at older she's and many do just fine.  Soon I will be working on my 4th child.. I am 39 and my oldest is 21 my youngest is 13. I'm very excited!

I'm 35 and my other kids are 19, 14, 11 and 9. I am starting all over as well. Unable to work either due to contractions so I am not able to do the things I'm use to. Luckily my husband is wonderful and supportive.

YESSS! Ifeel "too old" although this was a planned pregnancy bc of the AMA label I have been overly anxious about everything! I will be 41 at delivery... I have an 18 year old girl and a 17 year old boy. This is really starting from scratch. My husband is excited bc this is his first and it's a boy...due 7 days before HIS birthday (Aug 11th).

I am 37 with a 17 yo son. I am a bit nervous with the extra risks of advanced age but I think this baby will be luckier because with advanced age, I have more patience, understanding, and better financial stability.  I also notice many more women are waiting until mid 30s to have children or have more children later. This one was an oops pregnancy but I am really happy because now I will have a daughter that I never thought I would have.
Oh and to Sahaaj, I am due on Aug. 11th. ;-)
I am 38 and just had number #4 dec.30th my other children are 20yr,18yr and 14yr.
I'll be 41 when my second is born in September! I have a 13 year old and she's excited to have a sibling! :) My mind is young still but my body is kicking me for waiting so long!

question: I'm not sure how many have felt like to old to be pregnant. My youngest is 10  years old now and this pregnancy has been so hard had to stop working and the sickness has been ongoing I'll be 7 month's on Saturday. I can't wait to meet him
title: 36 pregnant with my 6th
